sub_title: University lecturer/Teacher educator in Bilingual Education and Content & Language Integrated Learning (CLIL)
summary:
Teacher educator, educational researcher and coordinator of the World Teachers Programme at ICLON Leiden University Graduate School of Teaching. Specialisms and interests include bilingual education, content and language integrated learning, and justice, equity, diversity and inclusion in (teacher) education.

PhD entitled 'Chicken, egg or a bit of both? Motivation in bilingual education (TTO) in the Netherlands' completed under the supervision of Professor Do Coyle at the University of Aberdeen and Professor Rick de Graaff at Utrecht University.

Former member of the Meesterschapsteam Vakdidactiek Moderne Vreemde Talen, an inter-university expert group concerned with strengthening Modern Foreign Languages education in the Netherlands.

Depending on where you are, you may know this as Content and Language Integrated Learning (CLIL) or under another name. 

Through such approaches, learners develop as language users but also have the opportunity to broaden their horizons and to grow as global citizens. In these uncertain and even tumultuous times, having the knowledge, skills and attitudes to communicate across and within cultures and communities has never been more important.

Against this backdrop and in the spirit of strengthening our own international community, the World CLIL 2022 conference aims to bring together teachers, policy-makers and researchers from diverse cultural, linguistic and professional backgrounds.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Tessa', 'last_name': 'Mearns', 'name': None, 'headline': 'University lecturer/Teacher educator in Bilingual Education and Content & Language Integrated Learning (CLIL)'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Lineke', 'last_name': 'Ouwendijk', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Project officer bilingual education ✵ Coordinator network bilingual vocational education ✵ Want to know more about bilingual education in The Netherlands?
